segment.source: Before you can deploy and run Microsoft Enterprise Desktop Virtualization (MED-V) 2.0, you must ensure that your environment meets the following minimum prerequisites.
segment.target: Before you can deploy and run Microsoft Enterprise Desktop Virtualization (MED-V) 2.0, you must ensure that your environment meets the following minimum prerequisites.

segment.source: The MED-V Host Agent and the MED-V Workspace Packager are only supported in Windows 7 or newer.
segment.target: The MED-V Host Agent and the MED-V Workspace Packager are only supported in Windows 7 or newer.

segment.source: The MED-V Guest Agent is only supported in Windows XP SP3.
segment.target: The MED-V Guest Agent is only supported in Windows XP SP3.

segment.source: The MED-V Host and Guest agents and the MED-V Workspace Packager require the Microsoft .NET Framework 3.5 SP1.
segment.target: The MED-V Host and Guest agents and the MED-V Workspace Packager require the Microsoft .NET Framework 3.5 SP1.

segment.source: You must also install the update KB959209 (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=204950), which addresses several known application compatibility issues.
segment.target: You must also install the update KB959209 (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=204950), which addresses several known application compatibility issues.

segment.source: You must manually install the .NET Framework 3.5 SP1 and the update KB959209 into the Windows Virtual PC image that you prepare for use with MED-V.
segment.target: You must manually install the .NET Framework 3.5 SP1 and the update KB959209 into the Windows Virtual PC image that you prepare for use with MED-V.

segment.source: However, by default, the Microsoft .NET Framework 3.5 SP1 and the update are included when you install Windows 7 on the host computer.
segment.target: However, by default, the Microsoft .NET Framework 3.5 SP1 and the update are included when you install Windows 7 on the host computer.

segment.source: Group Policy provides the centralized management and configuration of operating systems, applications, and users' settings in an Active Directory environment.
segment.target: Group Policy provides the centralized management and configuration of operating systems, applications, and users' settings in an Active Directory environment.
